intro: Isoglossa densa, commonly known as the dense isogloss, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible roots. The plant features palmate leaves with a dense arrangement of lobes, giving it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Isoglossa densa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
